head.title: The Mideast Violence Strikes a Raw Nerve

hedline.hl1: The Mideast Violence Strikes a Raw Nerve

abstract.p: David V Bartram letter says Jews like him should be able to understand the intense frustration of Palestinians and condemn the way Israeli army and police are handling current violence

block.p: Re ''Among U.S. Jews, a Deep Pessimism Takes Hold'' (news article, Oct. 11):
Re ''Among U.S. Jews, a Deep Pessimism Takes Hold'' (news article, Oct. 11):

You assert that ''Jews in this country have rallied round the Israelis'' and that ''even those American Jews who believe that the Israeli Army may have been too quick to fire on rock-throwing Palestinians are not about to say so publicly right now.''

Yet as a Jew, I have no difficulty in saying publicly that the Israeli Army has been too quick to fire on rock-throwing Palestinians. Moreover, I am furious with Ariel Sharon -- but even more so with Prime Minister Ehud Barak, for his failure to give the Palestinians what is rightfully theirs.

Jews should be able to put themselves in Palestinian shoes and understand the intense frustration caused by years of subjugation and violence at the hands of the Israeli Army and police and Jewish vigilantes. It would surely not be difficult to find other Jews who think similarly.
DAVID V. BARTRAM Colorado Springs, Oct. 11, 2000
